You're traveling with your friends.

Here's a simplified game architecture

that's outside of the game specifically.

uh matchmaking, persistence, basically
everything that gets this game to fit

So the key insight I want to share and
why I draw this is your game client and
your game server are very frequently in
the same language and in the same
engine. The backend platform is a whole
other beast. It's typically a different
IDE, different language, different
frameworks, different deployment
processes. In fact, very often it is
multiple extra languages, multiple
addition deployment patterns.
Coordinating all that so that you have a
game that can work and be updated with
all those different pieces at the same
time becomes really challenging. And if
you're not careful, it becomes the
bottleneck for why you can't iterate on
your game.
So when the founders came to me talking

And then
someone broke the build. So now nobody

And you've seen this, their shoulders

So, they're opening up all these

So, now they've lost a couple more days.

And so from these case studies, we came

I wanted local development. I wanted you
